alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pulaski, northwestern Jackson and Rockcastle Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 229 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Level Green, or near Mount Vernon, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Spiro around 235 PM EDT. Maretburg, Burr and Wellhope around 240 PM EDT. Lake Linville, Renfro Valley, Flat Rock and Pine Hill around 245 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mount Vernon, Muellersville, Hummel, Hiatt, Orlando, Dudley Station, Wildie, Roundstone, Bummer, Conway, Snider, Goochland, Johnetta, Boone, Disputanta, Climax, Threelinks, Morrill, Clover Bottom and Kerby Knob. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential downpours are also occurring with this storm and may lead to ponding of water on roadways or localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
